item.title: Save On Lenovo, Samsung, And Amazon Fire Tablets During Cyber Monday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/save-on-lenovo-samsung-and-amazon-fire-tablets-during-cyber-monday/1100-6528143/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Tablet devices have come a long way over the last decade, but if you're looking for a quality screen, you're going to have to fork out some big cash for it. Fortunately, this Cyber Monday deal on the Lenovo M11 tablet is a tempting one, as you can pick up a budget tablet for just $140, a 30% discount when compared to its regular $200 asking price.

Lenovo M11 Tablet

$140 ($200)

The Lenovo M11 is an 11-inch tablet with a 1920 x 1200 90Hz screen. Specs-wise, it has 4GB of RAM, and an internal SSD storage capacity of 64GB that can be expanded with an SD card. While there are certainly more powerful tablets on the market, this is a great choice for standard, every-day use, especially if you're looking for something to handle simple functions like web browsing, video streaming. It's also a nice option for kids who might be too old for one of Amazon's Kindle tablets, as it comes with a pen that can be used to take notes and create art, similar to the iPad and the Apple Pencil.

If you need something more durable, Amazon is also selling a version of this tablet for $160 that comes with a folio case, so for the extra cash, you're getting a nice layer of protection with your purchase.

Another affordable tablet you can check out during Cyber Monday is the Samsung Galaxy Tab A9+ for $149 (was $220). It has a sharp 11-inch screen 64GB of internal storage capacity that can also be expanded through its MicroSD card slot, and it has a long-lasting battery. Don't expect resource-intensive apps to run smoothly on this, but again, if you're looking to browse the web, stream some TV shows, and do some social media scrolling, this is a budget-friendly tablet that can handle those tasks easily.In case the 64GB model doesn't offer enough room for all the files you want to use on it, you can grab a 128GB model for $199 (was $270). If you own a Samsung smartphone, you can link these devices up to quickly transfer files and photos using the company's app.

For a little bit more powerful, Amazon's Fire Max is another good tablet to consider. This is easily one of the biggest discounts we've seen to date for it, as you can grab 64GB model tablet with a keyboard case and a stylus for just $225 (was $355), or for the tablet on its own, you can get it at a 39% discount for $140. The 11-inch screen has a resolution of 2000 x 1200, the battery offers up to 14 hours of use from a full charge, and the included keyboard makes it a good back-up device for when you need to do some work away from home.

We've listed a few more tablet deals available in Amazon's Cyber Monday sale below. We're also rounding up all the best discounts on video games, electronics, and more at our Cyber Monday deals hub, so be sure to check that out if you're looking for more savings.

More Cyber Monday Tablet Deals

  • Lenovo M11 (64GB) -- $140 ($200)
  • Lenovo M11 with folio case -- $160 ($200)
  • Samsung Galaxy Tab A9+ (64GB) -- $149 ($220)
  • Samsung Galaxy Tab A9+ (128GB) -- $200 ($270)
  • Amazon Fire Max Tablet bundle (64GB) -- $225 ($355)
  • Amazon Fire Max Tablet (64GB) -- $140 ($230)

  • Get Dark Souls Board Game For Only $51 And Roleplaying Sourcebook For $30
  • PS5 Pro Disc Drive Is Sold Out At Most Retailers, But Walmart Has It (For Now)

item.title: This Official, Collectible Tetris Handheld Is Just $30 For Cyber Monday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/this-official-collectible-tetris-handheld-is-just-30-for-cyber-monday/1100-6528144/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you're looking for an easy way to play some classic retro games on the go, you can grab the My Arcade Tetis Pocket Player Pro for just $22.49 (normally $40) at Amazon. allowing you to play one of the greatest video games of all time without any annoying distractions.

My Arcade Tetris Pocket Player Pro

$22.49 ($40)

Like the other dedicated handheld gaming devices manufactured by My Arcade, the Tetris version sports is equipped with a high-resolution 2.75-inch full-color display and a vibrant shell design. The handheld is designed to be pocket-friendly, so if you're looking to keep it with you when you have to wait in line or for a coffee, this lightweight unit is very easy to carry around. The handheld is powered by four AAA batteries while on the go, but can also be plugged in to a USB-C cable and played tethered if you're sitting near a power outlet or USB port.

If you're looking to save some cash, you can save an extra 15% on your order when you spend $30 on select items, including the My Arcade Tetris Pocket Player Pro. Check out Amazon's sale page to see all the other eligible items.

The My Arcade Pocket Pro line of handhelds feature curated selections of all-time great games, so if you're in a collecting mood, there are Mega Man, Street Fighter 2, and Pac-Man handhelds to pick up. Most of these are also currently on sale, so you can save a few bucks on assembling a library of nostalgic gaming units.

My Arcade also makes a few other notable retro-inspired gaming devices. For a time capsule experience, there's a portable Pac-Man arcade cabinet for $30 (was $50). This has a 3.5-inch vertical screen and a big joystick, and it'll take up much less space than your traditional arcade cabinet. There's also the Tetris Go gamer from My Arcade, a Game Boy-like handheld preloaded with 301 games that's on sale for $20 (was $30). You'll find a list of all the discounted My Arcade handhelds below. For more savings on video games, collecitbles, and plenty else, check our Black Friday and Cyber Monday deals hub.

My Arcade Cyber Monday Deals

  • My Arcade Tetris Pocket Player Pro -- $22.49 ($40)
  • My Arcade Tetris Go Gamer -- $20 ($30)
  • My Arcade Atari 100-in-1 Pocket Player Pro -- $34.74 ($40)
  • My Arcade Galaga and Galaxian Pocket Player Pro -- $30 ($40)
  • My Arcade Mega Man 1-6 Pocket Player Pro -- $37 ($40)
  • My Arcade Ms. Pac-Man Pocket Player Pro -- $28 ($40)
  • My Arcade Pac-Man Joystick Player -- $30 ($50)
  • My Arcade Pac-Man Pocket Player Pro -- $28 ($40)
  • My Arcade Super Street Fighter 2 Pocket Player Pro -- $32 ($40)

item.title: Pokemon Go December 2024 Events: Raids, Spotlight Hours, Community Day, And More
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/pokemon-go-december-2024-events-raids-spotlight-hours-community-day-and-more/1100-6528075/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Pokemon Go's newest season, Dual Destiny, has officially begun, and the game is ushering it in with a variety of events and new content this month. In addition to new raid bosses and Spotlight Hours, Pokemon Go will introduce a handful of new Pokemon to catch over the next few weeks, including Polteageist and Gigantamax Lapras.

On top of that, the game has a number of different events lined up for December, including a two-day Community Day and the annual holiday celebration, which will take place over the course of two weeks this year. Read on for a look at all of the biggest events happening in Pokemon Go this month.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • December Raid Schedule
    • Max Battles
    • Five-star Raids
    • Mega Raids
    • Shadow Raids
  • December Spotlight Hours
  • Just My Cup Of Tea
    • Wild Encounters
    • Incense Encounters
    • Raids
  • Aspiring Dragons Research Day
  • Gigantamax Lapras Max Battle Day
  • Young & Wise
  • Necrozma Fusion Raid Day
  • Holiday Part 1
  • December Community Day
  • Holiday Part 2

December Raid Schedule

Pokemon Go is changing up its selection of raid bosses for December.

This month, players will have another chance to encounter Chill Drive Genesect and Altered Forme Giratina in five-star raids, while Mega Banette, Mega Latios and Latias, and Mega Abomasnow will appear in Mega Raids over the next few weeks.

More Dynamax Pokemon are also on the way. Dynamax forms of Machop, Krabby, and other monsters will appear in Power Spots as Max Battle bosses, and Shadow Regice will star in special Shadow Raids every weekend this month. You can see December's full raid schedule below:

Max Battles

December 3-9

  • Machop
  • Beldum
  • Wooloo
  • Falinks

December 9-23

  • Bulbasaur
  • Charmander
  • Squirtle
  • Krabby
  • Skwovet

December 23-January 6

  • Krabby
  • Cryogonal
  • Grookey
  • Scorbunny
  • Sobble

Five-star Raids

December 3-12

  • Genesect (Chill Drive)

December 26-January 4

  • Giratina (Altered Forme)

Mega Raids

December 3-12

  • Mega Banette

December 12-19

  • Mega Latios

December 19-26

  • Mega Latias

December 26-January 4

  • Mega Abomasnow

Shadow Raids

Weekends in December

  • Shadow Regice

December Spotlight Hours

Pokemon Go's weekly Spotlight Hour events return in December with a new selection of featured Pokemon and bonuses.

Every Tuesday evening from 6-7 PM local time, one particular Pokemon will be appearing more frequently in the wild, making this a good chance to fill out your Pokedex and stock up on candy. In addition, you'll earn an extra bonus during that hour, such as double Stardust for catching or evolving Pokemon.

You can see December's full Spotlight Hour schedule below:

December 3

  • Featured Pokemon: Sableye
  • Bonus: 2x catch Stardust

December 10

  • Featured Pokemon: Murkrow
  • Bonus: 2x catch XP

December 17

  • Featured Pokemon: Slugma and Bergmite
  • Bonus: 2x catch Candy

December 24

  • Featured Pokemon: Delibird wearing a holiday ribbon
  • Bonus: 2x transfer Candy

December 31

  • Featured Pokemon: Togetic
  • Bonus: 2x evolution XP

Just My Cup Of Tea

Pokemon Go is kicking its new season off with an event called Just My Cup of Tea, which runs from December 3-7.

The star of the event is the debuting tea Pokemon Sinistea, which will be available in raids and through completing Collection Challenges. You can evolve Sinistea into Polteageist after amassing 50 Sinistea Candy.

On top of that, a few other Pokemon such as Slowpoke, Duskull, and Greavard will be appearing more frequently in the wild during the event, while Galarian Mr. Mime, Hisuian Braviary, and Bombirdier will be available in raids.

Wild Encounters

  • Slowpoke
  • Taillow
  • Slakoth
  • Duskull
  • Starly
  • Greavard

Incense Encounters

  • Oddish
  • Miltank
  • Combee
  • Gothita
  • Litwick
  • Spritzee

Raids

One-star

  • Male Frillish
  • Female Frillish
  • Sinistea

Three-star

  • Galarian Mr. Mime
  • Hisuian Braviary
  • Bombirdier

Aspiring Dragons Research Day

Pokemon Go is hosting an Aspiring Dragons Research Day on December 7.

From 2-5 PM local time, you can encounter Pokemon that evolve into dragon types--such as Horsea, Trapinch, Swablu, and Skrelp--by completing Field Research tasks. Other Pokemon like Carvanha, Dwebble, and Ducklett will also be appearing more frequently in the wild during the event, and the in-game shop will offer a paid Timed Research ticket that leads to additional encounters with the featured Pokemon.

Gigantamax Lapras Max Battle Day

Following the Aspiring Dragons Research Day, Pokemon Go will host a Max Battle Day featuring Gigantamax Lapras on December 8.

From 2-5 PM local time, Gigantamax Lapras will appear in Max Battles as an extra challenging six-star raid boss. If you need help taking down the giant Pokemon, the game is also introducing a new type of item called Max Mushrooms, which will temporarily increase your Pokemon's damage output during a Max Battle.

On top of the Lapras raids, Pokemon Go will offer extra bonuses during the event. The game is temporarily increasing your Max Particle collection limit to 1,600, and you'll earn double the usual amount of Max Particles from exploring.

Young & Wise

Pokemon Go's Dual Destiny season continues with an event called Young and Wise, which is scheduled to run from December 10-14. More details will be announced closer to the event.

Necrozma Fusion Raid Day

The legendary Pokemon Necrozma is returning for a special Necrozma Fusion Raid Day on December 14.

From 2-5 PM local time, Necrozma's fused forms--Dusk Mane Necrozma and Dawn Wings Necrozma--will appear more frequently in raids. Not only that, but you'll have an increased chance of encountering a shiny Necrozma if you're able to defeat the legendary Pokemon in battle.

Pokemon Go will also offer a special paid ticket through the in-game item shop. Everyone who purchases this ticket will receive some extra perks during the event, such as increased XP and Stardust from raids and additional Raid Passes.

Holiday Part 1

Pokemon Go's annual Holiday event returns later this month. The first part is scheduled to run from December 17-22. More will be announced closer to the event.

Pokemon Go's final Community Day event of the year will take place across two days, from December 21-22.

Holiday Part 2

The second part of Pokemon Go's holiday event will run from December 22-27. Additional details will be announced later this month.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
